engine.space

Class AABB

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.space.AABB

  • public class AABB
extends java.lang.Object
    A 3D axis-aligned bounding box.
    Author:
    Benny Bobaganoosh (thebennybox@gmail.com)

    • Constructor Summary

      • contains

        public boolean contains(AABB other)
        Tests whether another AABB is completely contained by this one.
        Parameters:
        other - The AABB being tested for containment
        Returns:
        True if other is contained by this AABB, false otherwise.

      • intersects

        public boolean intersects(AABB other)
        Tests whether another AABB is intersecting this one.
        Parameters:
        other - The AABB being tested for intersection
        Returns:
        True if other is intersecting this AABB, false otherwise.

      • intersectRect

        public boolean intersectRect(double minX,
                    double minY,
                    double maxX,
                    double maxY)
        Tests whether this AABB intersects a rectangle.
        Parameters:
        minX - The minimum extent of the rectangle on X.
        minY - The minimum extent of the rectangle on Y.
        maxX - The maximum extent of the rectangle on X.
        maxY - The maximum extent of the rectangle on Y.
        Returns:
        True if the rectangle intersects this AABB, false otherwise.

      • intersectCube

        public boolean intersectCube(double minX,
                    double minY,
                    double minZ,
                    double maxX,
                    double maxY,
                    double maxZ)
        Tests whether this AABB intersects a cube.
        Parameters:
        minX - The minimum extent of the cube on X.
        minY - The minimum extent of the cube on Y.
        minZ - The minimum extent of the cube on Z.
        maxX - The maximum extent of the cube on X.
        maxY - The maximum extent of the cube on Y.
        maxZ - The maximum extent of the cube on Z.
        Returns:
        True if the cube intersects this AABB, false otherwise.

      • resolveCollisionX

        public double resolveCollisionX(AABB other,
                       double moveAmtX)
        Adjusts a movement amount on X so that after the move is performed, this AABB will not intersect other.

        This method assumes that this AABB can actually intersect other after some amount of movement on x, even if it won't necessarily intersect it after the movement specified by moveAmtX.

        Parameters:
        other - The AABB that this AABB is resolving against.
        moveAmtX - The amount this AABB is trying to move.
        Returns:
        The new, adjusted move amount that guarantees no intersection.

      • resolveCollisionY

        public double resolveCollisionY(AABB other,
                       double moveAmtY)
        Adjusts a movement amount on Y so that after the move is performed, this AABB will not intersect other.

        This method assumes that this AABB can actually intersect other after some amount of movement on y, even if it won't necessarily intersect it after the movement specified by moveAmtY.

        Parameters:
        other - The AABB that this AABB is resolving against.
        moveAmtY - The amount this AABB is trying to move.
        Returns:
        The new, adjusted move amount that guarantees no intersection.

      • stretch

        public AABB stretch(double amtX,
           double amtY)
        Creates a new AABB equivalent to this, but stretched by a certain amount.
        Parameters:
        amtX - The amount to stretch on X
        amtY - The amount to stretch on Y.
        Returns:
        A new AABB, stretched by the specified amounts.

      • scale

        public AABB scale(double scaleX,
         double scaleY,
         double scaleZ)
        Creates a new AABB equivalent to this, but scaled away from the origin by a certain amount.
        Parameters:
        scaleX - Amount to scale on X.
        scaleY - Amount to scale on Y.
        scaleZ - Amount to scale on Z.
        Returns:
        A new AABB, scaled by the specified amounts.
